item.title: Dante add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Dante add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Dante add a quote by Alan Jacobs
item.description: "Read what gives you delight—at least most of the time—and do so without shame. And even if you are that rare sort of person who is delighted chiefl y by what some people call Great Books, don’t make them your steady intellectual diet, any more than you would eat at the most elegant of restaurants every day. It would be too much. Great books are great in part because of what they ask of their readers: they are not readily encountered, easily assessed." -- Alan Jacobs

item.title: Dante add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Dante add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Dante add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Dante add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Dante add a quote by Mortimer Adler
item.description: "Books are absent teachers." -- Mortimer Adler

item.title: Dante add a quote by Mortimer Adler
item.description: "If you are reading in order to become a better reader, you cannot read just any book or article. You will not improve as a reader if all you read are books that are well within your capacity. You must tackle books that are beyond you, or, as we have said, books that are over your head. Only books of that sort will make you stretch your mind. And unless you stretch, you will not learn." -- Mortimer Adler

item.title: Dante add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Dante add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "The forceps of our minds are clumsy forceps, and crush the truth a little in taking hold of it." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Dante add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Dante add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Dante add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Dante add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Dante add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dante add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Dante add a quote by John Burroughs
item.description: "The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are." -- John Burroughs

item.title: Dante add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Dante add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Dante add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Dante add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "The one thing that unites all human beings, regardless of age, gender, religion, economic status, or ethnic background, is that, deep down inside, we all believe that we are above-average drivers." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Dante add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Life is always either a tightrope or a feather bed. Give me the tightrope." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Dante add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dante add a quote by Samuel Lover
item.description: "Circumstances are the rulers of the weak; they are but the instruments of the wise." -- Samuel Lover

item.title: Dante add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Dante add a quote by William Shakespeare
Dante add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton

item.title: Dante add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Dante add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace
